result.title: Catalogue of Best Practices
result.description: WP leader FUOC, by drawing an all results emerging from national surveys and in cooperation with all involved partners, will eventually come out with a catalogue of best practices in media representation of gender and immigration, to be put to the attention of EU policy-makers as a knowledge base for the implementation of new strategies for fighting stereotypes and discriminations.

result.title: Citizen Journalism in Ten Countries
result.description: The deliverable will collect and assemble the following reports: Report on Citizen Journalism in Italy (IULM); Report on Citizen Journalism in Germany (RUB); Report on Citizen Journalism in Bulgaria (NBU); Report on Citizen Journalism in Spain (FUOC); Report on Citizen Journalism in Belgium (UGent); Report on Citizen Journalism in Greece (NKUA); Report on Citizen Journalism in Portugal (ISCTE); Report on Citizen Journalism in Sweden (IKED); Report on Citizen Journalism in Czech Republic (CU).

result.title: White Book of Recommendations
result.description: By drawing on the results of the previous tasks, and by also considering deliverables from WPs 1-4, we will come out with an informal White Book of Recommendations for European policy-makers, related to all fields analysed in the EUMEPLAT project.

result.title: Catalogue of Best Practices and Main Obstacles to Europeanisation
result.description: Basing on D3.2 and D3.3, IULM will coordinate the definition of a catalogue of best practices in intra-European production, circulation and consumption of video, along with a list of main obstacles to the Europeanisation of video landscape.

result.description: In-depth theoretical investigation on the destructive effects of digitization (pollution, dumping, environmental damages, military applications), which require a deeper understanding. The report will provide an original and unprecedented recognition of these main issues, which will make necessary a regulatory intervention in the years to come.

result.title: Assessing Externalities: Toxic Debate and Pluralistic Values
result.description: Theoretical report on the spread of toxic debate and digital threats to the sharing of positive and pluralistic values, by also drawing on the results of WPs 2 and 4. The report will draw predictive trends about the conflict which is expected to take place in European media landscape.

result.description: Theoretical report on the role of digital surveillance and the forms of resistance to hegemonic powers, by also drawing on the results of WPs 2, 3 and 4. The report will draw predictive trends about the conflict which is expected to take place in European media landscape.
